column4: Anyone know why I dont have a Debian link under Applications?
btw - NetBeans comes as a "bin" file - change this to be executable - it is the installer
you should "sudo ./filename.bin" - otherwise Java and Netbeans will only be installed in your home dir!
Yep - but this is a commercial tool and only available for windows ;-)
oh, I didnt know it was only for Windows. I do know it is free though
TextPad is free????
I bought licenses last year... huh?
I downloaded it and I have never paid for it
JEdit should be quite OK and runs everywhere (Java)
Yes, I have JEdit on windows, so that is on Linux too?
Yes - Java runs *everywhere* - Mac, Windows, Linux...
will that be under the symnaptic thing?
So does nearly any Java program
NetBeans itself is also written in Java
cool
Is JEdit on the Synaptic Package Manager?
Nope - sorry, you have to download yourself
The Debian package should work
GREAT..... ... one sec, I might need help
Or use the Java based installer
Assumed that you have Java installed of course
And I have Netbeans.......YEAH....
Fine :) Hope you will like it as much as i do ;-)
